oe_questions.question: Explain the collaboration mechanism between the Class Loader, Memory Areas, and the Execution Engine in the JVM when running a Java program.
Compare and contrast Minor GC, Major GC, and Full GC in terms of the JVM memory areas they affect and their impact on application performance (Stop-The-World pauses).
Discuss the trade-offs between high cohesion and low coupling in software design. Provide a practical example (not necessarily from the provided sources) to illustrate these concepts.
Explain the core difference between Inheritance and Composition in OOP, highlighting the benefits of favoring Composition as described in the sources.
Describe the purposes of JVM Profiling and how to do it (from attaching profiler to reading the reports).
